name: DeleteValue
documentation:
Command to delete a value from the legacy key-value store by key.

This removes the value associated with the specified {@code key} from the key-value store. This command is part of the legacy storage system and is primarily relevant in older Fluxzero applications that still use {@code StoreValues} or {@code StoreValueIfAbsent}.

Behavior

  • If the key does not exist, the operation is a no-op.
  • The deletion is governed by the specified {@link Guarantee}.

Usage Notes

  • For most modern use cases, consider using the document store or {@code SearchClient} instead.
  • This command is typically used for cleanup, invalidation, or state transitions in legacy flows.
@see StoreValues @see StoreValueIfAbsent @see Guarantee

fields.name: guarantee
fields.documentation: Persistence guarantee to apply to the deletion.

fields.name: key
fields.documentation: The key of the entry to delete.

methods.name: routingKey
methods.documentation:
Routing key used by the Fluxzero Runtime to shard or partition this command.

 @return the key being deleted
